sourceDesc.bibl: "U.S. Health Plan Seen as Foe of Planned Parenthood", El Paso Herald Post, May 2, 1949, p. 20

headNote.p: Sanger provided the press with comments while in El Paso, staying with Betty-Mary Goetting. For a speech she gave in San Angelo later that wee see Preparation of Parenthood for World Peace, May 5, 1949.

docBody.head: U.S. Health Plan Seen As Foe of Planned Parenthood

p.q: Socialized medicine is a serious threat to the planned parenthood movement, Mrs. Sanger, world pioneer of the movement, said in El Paso today.

docBody.p: “A medical program under government control would permit pressure groups hostile to planned parenthood to stifle the movement through political pressure,” she said.

“Already in the state public health programs of Massachusetts and Connecticut certain doctors have been forbidden the use of hospital facilities because political blocs objected to their being in favor of planned parenthood,” she added.

p.q: Mrs. Sanger was the house guest of Mrs. Charles Goetting of Rosedale Addition in the Lower Valley. Mrs. Goetting is honorary president of the Planned Parenthood Center of El Paso at 1926 Arizona street.

Members of the local Planned Parenthood Center, headed by Mrs. A. Ransford Fletcher, president, will accompany Mrs. Sanger to San Angelo for the state planned parenthood convention to be held on Wednesday and Thursday.
Mrs. Sanger will speak there on "Preparation of Parenthood for World Peace."
